titleStmt.title: William H. Baker et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7629

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
His Excelencey Thos E. Bramlette
Govenor of Kentucky

Your petitioners Residents of Boone County Kentucky Respectfully Represent to your Exclency that at the April Term of the Boone Circuit Court 1866 Reason R McNamara was fined Sixty Dollars ($60) for Keeping A tipling House the facts are as follows viz the offence was Committid at the Boone fair Ground Some friends of the Defendent McNamara was keeping A Grocery at the fair Ground and Employed McNamara to assist them ^in^ said Grocery and while in said Grocery did violate the Law by Selling Spiritous Liquors Your petitioners further Represent that the Defendent is an Honest Law-abiding Citizen and has a family dependent on his dayley Labor for a Support and as it is his first offince against the Law your petitioners ask your Honor to Remit said fine & allow the whole Labor of the Deft to be applied to the Support of his familey and your petitioners as in duty bound will ever pray

Wm H Ba
Wm H Barker
John Horton
John A Storey
F M Howlett
J A Johnson
F. Q. Baker S. B. C.
Baker D S B C
G B Hume
J. C. Finnell
